qas.question: How much money was allocated to advertise Windows 8?
How much money was allocated to advertise Windows 95?
What is the name of the character Microsoft used to make Windows 8 seem more personable?
When did Microsoft begin promoting Windows 8?
How many pop up stores did Microsoft set up to help promote Windows 8?
How much money was allocated to advertise Windows 9?
How much money was allocated to advertise Windows 98?
What is the name of the character Microsoft used to make Windows 9 seem more personable?
When did Microsoft begin promoting Windows 9?
How many pop up stores did Microsoft set up to help promote Windows 9?

context: Microsoft began an advertising campaign centered around Windows 8 and its Surface tablet in <a3_0><b8_0>October 2012<b8_0/><a3_0/>, starting with its first television advertisement premiering on October 14, 2012. Microsoft's advertising budget of <b5_0>US<a0_0>$1.5–1.8 billion<b5_0/><a0_0/> was significantly larger than the <b6_0>US<a1_0>$200<b6_0/> million<a1_0/> campaign used to promote Windows 95. As part of its campaign, Microsoft set up <a4_0><b9_0>34<b9_0/><a4_0/> pop-up stores inside malls (primarily focusing on Surface), provided training for retail employees in partnership with Intel, and collaborated with the electronics store chain Best Buy to design expanded spaces to showcase devices. In an effort to make retail displays of Windows 8 devices more "personal", Microsoft also developed a character known in English-speaking markets as "<a2_0><b7_0>Allison Brown<b7_0/><a2_0/>", whose fictional profile (including personal photos, contacts, and emails) is also featured on demonstration units of Windows 8 devices.
